content.title: Introduction
content.content: This lesson guides you through installing the FTC SDK in Android Studio, the official development environment for advanced FTC programming. Following these steps ensures your team can build, test, and deploy code efficiently.

content.title: Prerequisites
content.content:
• Android Studio installed (Download here)
  • Basic understanding of Java and Git
  • Internet connection

content.title: Step-by-Step Installation
content.content:
1. Download the FTC SDK:
    Visit the FTC SDK GitHub repository and click Code > Download ZIP or clone with Git:
    git clone https://github.com/FIRST-Tech-Challenge/FtcRobotController.git
  2. Open in Android Studio:
    Launch Android Studio. Select Open an existing project and choose the FtcRobotController folder.
  3. Let Gradle Sync:
    Android Studio will automatically sync Gradle. Wait for the process to finish. If prompted, install any missing SDK components.
  4. Configure Device:
    Connect your Control Hub or Android phone via USB. Enable Developer Options and USB Debugging on the device.
  5. Build and Deploy:
    Click the Run button (green triangle) to build and deploy the app to your device.

content.title: Troubleshooting
content.content:
• Gradle Sync Fails: Check your internet connection and ensure all required SDK components are installed.
  • Device Not Detected: Make sure USB Debugging is enabled and the correct drivers are installed.
  • Build Errors: Clean the project (Build > Clean Project) and try again.

content.title: Best Practices & Safety
content.content:
• Always use the latest stable FTC SDK release.
  • Do not modify SDK core files; write your code in the TeamCode module.
  • Back up your code regularly using Git or another version control system.
